#summary List of projects that use BridJ

Please keep in mind that [CreditsAndLicense BridJ is licensed under the BSD license], so anyone using it must state it appropriately in the documentation and/or other distributed materials (but there's no need to publish any modified sources, although it is good practice ;-)).

Here are some of the projects known to use BridJ internally (please post [http://groups.google.com/group/nativelibs4java on the mailing list] if you'd like your project to be listed here) :

= Projects on the wild =

  * [https://github.com/atsushieno/falplayer-android-j falplayer-android-j] (MIT-licensed) : [https://github.com/atsushieno Atsushi Eno]'s experimental Java port of [https://github.com/atsushieno/falplayer-android falplayer], a "repeatable OGG Vorbis player for Android"
  * [http://code.google.com/p/javacl/ JavaCL] (BSD-licensed) : OpenCL bindings for Java (JavaCL uses JNA by default but has a BridJ port available as the javacl-bridj Maven artifact)
  * [http://code.google.com/p/scalacl/ ScalaCL] (BSD-licensed) : optimizing Scala compiler plugin + GPU-backed collections (using OpenCL)
